M3xM

the overhaul of my personal website, now powered by Jekyll

I'm a nightmare client. My own nightmare client. As soon as it comes to make a website for myself: I love nothing. I design, iterate, sleep on it and delete for ever. Repeat a million times.

That said, I really needed to have my own place where I can showcase my projects and client work. So I tried to come up with a design that is so simple, so minimalist that I have no more reason to dislike it.

Almost no colors. No trendy effects or patterns whatsoever. So I placed type at the center of this website. Meta Serif Web Pro is one of my favorite modern serif ever and I couldn't resist to use it here.

Later in that process, I wondered: should I use a CMS? Building a simple portfolio on top of Wordpress feels like killing a mosquito with napalm really. Effective but really disproportionate. That's how I came across Jekyll. Jekyll really blew my mind. That was exactly what I was looking for. Jekyll basically generates a static website from a bunch of templates you create. I then push my changes to Github and get the result in a second.
